If the US has a chance to assassinate Saddam, should they?
Assasinate as in pop Baghdad with a couple dozen cruise missles or a bullet to the head. Because if it is the latter, I say go for it.
If we assassinate Saddam, Bush would have nothing to fight for. We would then be resorted to looking for bin Laden in the middle of Afghanistan or picking a fight with some other country.
We can't assasinate Saddam...what about the invasion...what about cheaper gas?? Assasinating Saddam is to economical and practical...goes against presidential policy.
you think the government hasnt assisinated or attemped to assisinate military leaders before?

Military officials say Bush may order the assassination of Saddam!

Heh, thistown.

Most of those guards around him don't even have loaded guns...he has around seven doubles, doesn't make public appearances, doesn't stay in the same place for long... hardly a practical solution. Kill Saddam and another member of the regime takes over. You have to wipe out the regime.
The ideology won't die that easy, and broker's right. That's somethin' to think think about.

I agree mostly with what Broker said, except that someone would just step in and sit on the throne of Iraq, I believe there would be a civil war that would probably last until someone else(the US) stopped it. Which would mean in the long run, more civillians would die than if we invaded and just took him out, but if it were feasable to assassinate him we should, followed by a fast invasion to stop civil war from erupting in Iraq, I believe that an ivasion with Sadam dead would mean far less bloodshed as the Iraqis would not be scared to surrender.
